sentence.text: Aberrant expression of different family members of the positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin system, which comprises the Eph receptors (Ephs) and their ligands (ephrins), has been implicated in various malignancies including breast cancer.
This review reflects the existing positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin literature while focusing on breast cancer heterogeneity.

Hormone positive, signal transduction positive and triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) cell lines, xenografts/mutant animal models and patient samples are examined separately as, in humans, they represent entities with differences in prognosis and treatment.
positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesionA2, EphB4 and EphB6 are the members most extensively studied in breast cancer.

Existing research points to the potential use of various positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion/ephrin members as biomarkers for assessing prognosis and selecting the most suitable thtranscription by RNA polymerase IIpeutic strategies in variable clinical scenarios, also for overcoming drug resistance, in the era of breast cancer heterogeneity
